title: NASA’s Perseverance Rover Looks Back While Climbing Slippery Slope
summary: On its way up the side of Jezero Crater, the agency’s latest Red Planet off-roader peers all the way back to its landing site and scopes the path ahead.   NASA’s Perseverance Mars rover is negotiating a steeply sloping route up Jezero Crater’s western wall with the aim of cresting the rim in early December. […]

title: NASA Identifies Root Cause of Orion Heat Shield Char Loss
summary: NASA has identified the root cause of the unexpected char loss on Orion’s heat shield after it returned from the Artemis I uncrewed test flight to the Moon almost two...

title: NASA Announces STEM Engagement Lead, Chief Economist Retirements
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson announced Monday Mike Kincaid, associate administrator, Office of STEM Engagement (OSTEM), and Alexander MacDonald, chief economist, will retire from the agency. Following Kincaid’s departure on Nov. 30, Kris Brown, deputy associate administrator for strategy and integration in OSTEM, will serve as acting associate administrator for that office beginning Dec. 1, and […]

title: Satellite servicing industry faces uncertain military demand
summary: Refueling in orbit remains the most compelling service but more advanced services like component replacement or payload repairs have not yet won military buy-in

title: NASA Successfully Integrates Coronagraph for Roman Space Telescope
summary: NASA’s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope team has successfully completed integration of the Roman Coronagraph Instrument onto Roman’s Instrument Carrier, a piece of infrastructure that will hold the mission’s instruments, which will be integrated onto the larger spacecraft at a later date. The Roman Coronagraph is a technology demonstration that scientists will use to take […]

title: ESA Selects Four Companies to Develop Reusable Rocket Technology
summary: The European Space Agency has selected Rocket Factory Augsburg, The Exploration Company, ArianeGroup, and Isar Aerospace to develop reusable rocket technology. On 9 October, ESA held its Future Space Transportation Award Ceremony in Paris. During the event, the agency announced the four awardees under two initiatives focused on the development of reusable rocket technology: the […]

title: NASA Announces Nine Landing Sites for Artemis III Mission
summary: NASA Announces Nine Landing Sites for Artemis III Mission

title: NASA Provides Update on Artemis III Moon Landing Regions
summary: As NASA prepares for the first crewed Moon landing in more than five decades, the agency has identified an updated set of nine potential landing regions near the lunar South Pole for its Artemis III mission. These areas will be further investigated through scientific and engineering study. NASA will continue to survey potential areas for […]

title: Hera asteroid mission’s CubeSat passengers signal home
summary: The two CubeSat passengers aboard ESA’s Hera mission for planetary defence have exchanged their first signals with Earth, confirming their nominal status. The pair were switched on to check out all their systems, marking the first operation of ESA CubeSats in deep space.

title: ESA plans measures to help European space industry
summary: ESA is proposing steps to support a space industry that has been “under pressure” recently while keeping a watchful eye on one proposed deal.
